item.title: Paolo Iacobucci - 2016-07-23 11:14:47
item.content:encoded:
Buongiorno Clara,
mi chiamo Paolo Iacobucci,e mi occupo fondamentalmente di Psicologia e Psicobiologia.
Ho deciso di scriverti -perdona il tono confidenziale, ma almeno negli Stati Uniti il "lei" non esiste- ma ieri pomeriggio il mio dentista, il Dott. Magrini, sapendo che a meta' Agosto mi trasferiro' a Brookline, Boston, per un Master in Psicologia, mi ha parlato di te e della tua arte, concludendo dicendomi che presto ti esibirai proprio a Boston.
Dopo aver ascoltato su internet alcune tue composizioni, ho pensato che mi farebbe piacere sapere se/quando ti esibirai prossimamente in questa città' per avere l'opportunità' di ascoltarti dal vivo.
Ti ringrazio in anticipo per l'attenzione (stavolta mi consento un minimo di formalità') e ti faccio i miei più' sentiti complimenti per la tua arte originale e stimolante.
Ciao
Paolo <!--more--> AUTHOR: Paolo Iacobucci AUTHOR EMAIL: mm20012010@hotmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 79.42.216.200 Array ( [Name] => Paolo Iacobucci [E-mail Address] => mm20012010@hotmail.com [Message] => Buongiorno Clara,
mi chiamo Paolo Iacobucci,e mi occupo fondamentalmente di Psicologia e Psicobiologia.
Ho deciso di scriverti -perdona il tono confidenziale, ma almeno negli Stati Uniti il "lei" non esiste- ma ieri pomeriggio il mio dentista, il Dott. Magrini, sapendo che a meta' Agosto mi trasferiro' a Brookline, Boston, per un Master in Psicologia, mi ha parlato di te e della tua arte, concludendo dicendomi che presto ti esibirai proprio a Boston.
Dopo aver ascoltato su internet alcune tue composizioni, ho pensato che mi farebbe piacere sapere se/quando ti esibirai prossimamente in questa città' per avere l'opportunità' di ascoltarti dal vivo.
Ti ringrazio in anticipo per l'attenzione (stavolta mi consento un minimo di formalità') e ti faccio i miei più' sentiti complimenti per la tua arte originale e stimolante.
Ciao
Paolo )

item.title: Alba Gentili-Tedeschi - 2016-07-25 17:35:48
item.content:encoded: Ciao Clara, innanzitutto complimenti per il tuo lavoro. Sono una berlinese d'adozione anch'io, sono pianista e membro del trio transmitter (triotransmitter.com). Con il mio ensemble stiamo al momento cercando finanziamenti per un concerto che vogliamo fare a Berlino probabilmente a novembre 2017, e vorremmo chiederti se fossi interessata a scrivere un pezzo per noi oppure ad adattare "the people here go mad. they blame the wind" per il nostro organico (violino o viola al posto di violoncello). Grazie mille e se sei a Berlino in questo periodo possiamo anche vederci di persona, se ti va! In bocca al lupo per tutto, Alba Gentili <!--more--> AUTHOR: Alba Gentili-Tedeschi AUTHOR EMAIL: albagentilitedeschi@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 93.71.56.135 Array ( [Name] => Alba Gentili-Tedeschi [E-mail Address] => albagentilitedeschi@gmail.com [Message] => Ciao Clara, innanzitutto complimenti per il tuo lavoro. Sono una berlinese d'adozione anch'io, sono pianista e membro del trio transmitter (triotransmitter.com). Con il mio ensemble stiamo al momento cercando finanziamenti per un concerto che vogliamo fare a Berlino probabilmente a novembre 2017, e vorremmo chiederti se fossi interessata a scrivere un pezzo per noi oppure ad adattare "the people here go mad. they blame the wind" per il nostro organico (violino o viola al posto di violoncello). Grazie mille e se sei a Berlino in questo periodo possiamo anche vederci di persona, se ti va! In bocca al lupo per tutto, Alba Gentili )

item.title: Ellen Grolman - 2016-07-26 22:21:57
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta, Music of our Mothers is a weekly, 2-hour live radio show airing exclusively classical works by women composers on WFCF 88.5 FM, Flagler College Radio, in St. Augustine, Florida and on WFWM 91.9 FM in Frostburg, Maryland. As the on-air host of this show, I strive to bring our listeners a wide variety of musical genres, styles, compositional approaches, and performances. To that end, I write to inquire if you might provide me with a compilation CD of your works (or promotional copies of the commercial ones), portions of which I wish to air on Music of our Mothers. I can receive mp3 files if you prefer. Please include performer/conductor/duration details for each movement as well as program notes if available. My address is below. Thank you for your consideration.​
Ellen K. Grolman 192 Anastasia Lakes Drive St. Augustine, FL 32080 301. 268.8998 www.musicofourmothers.com <!--more--> AUTHOR: Ellen Grolman AUTHOR EMAIL: egrolman@frostburg.edu AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 24.198.211.72 Array ( [Name] => Ellen Grolman [E-mail Address] => egrolman@frostburg.edu [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta, Music of our Mothers is a weekly, 2-hour live radio show airing exclusively classical works by women composers on WFCF 88.5 FM, Flagler College Radio, in St. Augustine, Florida and on WFWM 91.9 FM in Frostburg, Maryland. As the on-air host of this show, I strive to bring our listeners a wide variety of musical genres, styles, compositional approaches, and performances. To that end, I write to inquire if you might provide me with a compilation CD of your works (or promotional copies of the commercial ones), portions of which I wish to air on Music of our Mothers. I can receive mp3 files if you prefer. Please include performer/conductor/duration details for each movement as well as program notes if available. My address is below. Thank you for your consideration.​
Ellen K. Grolman 192 Anastasia Lakes Drive St. Augustine, FL 32080 301. 268.8998 www.musicofourmothers.com
)

item.title: Daniel Curtis - 2016-08-10 22:03:50
item.content:encoded:
To Whom It May Concern:
My name is Daniel Curtis and I am the directory of the Contemporary Ensemble at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, PA. I have programmed Clara Iannotta's "Intent on Resurrection..." on our first concert to take place on October 9th and today I filled out an order form for electronic delivery of performance materials for that work. I inputted credit card information and the purchase went through about an hour ago. I have been checking my email, hoping to see the files, but so far I haven't received anything. I am writing you now to follow up on my order and make sure that I entered payment correctly and the order was processed. Please let me know if there is anything I should do to complete the order. I am eager to receive these materials in order to start preparing for our upcoming concert.
All my best,
Daniel <!--more--> AUTHOR: Daniel Curtis AUTHOR EMAIL: daniel.nesta.curtis@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 128.2.102.124 Array ( [Name] => Daniel Curtis [E-mail Address] => daniel.nesta.curtis@gmail.com [Message] => To Whom It May Concern:
My name is Daniel Curtis and I am the directory of the Contemporary Ensemble at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, PA. I have programmed Clara Iannotta's "Intent on Resurrection..." on our first concert to take place on October 9th and today I filled out an order form for electronic delivery of performance materials for that work. I inputted credit card information and the purchase went through about an hour ago. I have been checking my email, hoping to see the files, but so far I haven't received anything. I am writing you now to follow up on my order and make sure that I entered payment correctly and the order was processed. Please let me know if there is anything I should do to complete the order. I am eager to receive these materials in order to start preparing for our upcoming concert.
All my best,
Daniel )

a:3:{s:4:"Name";s:13:"Daniel Curtis";s:14:"E-mail Address";s:29:"daniel.nesta.curtis@gmail.com";s:7:"Message";s:869:"To Whom It May Concern:
My name is Daniel Curtis and I am the directory of the Contemporary Ensemble at Carnegie Mellon University in Pittsburgh, PA. I have programmed Clara Iannotta's "Intent on Resurrection..." on our first concert to take place on October 9th and today I filled out an order form for electronic delivery of performance materials for that work. I inputted credit card information and the purchase went through about an hour ago. I have been checking my email, hoping to see the files, but so far I haven't received anything. I am writing you now to follow up on my order and make sure that I entered payment correctly and the order was processed. Please let me know if there is anything I should do to complete the order. I am eager to receive these materials in order to start preparing for our upcoming concert.
All my best,
Daniel";}

item.title: Andrew McIntosh - 2016-09-02 20:35:15
item.content:encoded:
Hi Clara,
I don't know if you remember me, we met briefly at Aperture Duo's concert with your piece in LA a number of months ago. I'm a composer/violinist/violist currently teaching at CalArts and am interested in "dead wasps in the jam-jar" (or any other solo violin or viola music in your catalogue). How would I go about obtaining a score?
Thanks! -A. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Andrew McIntosh AUTHOR EMAIL: mcintosh@plainsound.org AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 71.145.237.170 Array ( [Name] => Andrew McIntosh [E-mail Address] => mcintosh@plainsound.org [Message] => Hi Clara,
I don't know if you remember me, we met briefly at Aperture Duo's concert with your piece in LA a number of months ago. I'm a composer/violinist/violist currently teaching at CalArts and am interested in "dead wasps in the jam-jar" (or any other solo violin or viola music in your catalogue). How would I go about obtaining a score?
Thanks! -A. )

item.title: Gordon Williamson - 2016-09-04 23:26:06
item.content:encoded: Hi Clara, we met in Witten when you had a piece there with Trio Catch, maybe two years ago? I'm still in Hannover and the HGNM here organizes some moderated concerts with guest composers. I'm not sure if you're still traveling back and forth between Boston and Berlin? If you are, it could be nice to invite you to Hannover in 2017 with your new accordion and viola piece. It would be nice to talk more about it over email, so please just send me a message. Thanks and hope to hear from you soon! Gordon Williamson <!--more--> AUTHOR: Gordon Williamson AUTHOR EMAIL: gordon.williamson@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 31.18.252.223 Array ( [Name] => Gordon Williamson [E-mail Address] => gordon.williamson@gmail.com [Message] => Hi Clara, we met in Witten when you had a piece there with Trio Catch, maybe two years ago? I'm still in Hannover and the HGNM here organizes some moderated concerts with guest composers. I'm not sure if you're still traveling back and forth between Boston and Berlin? If you are, it could be nice to invite you to Hannover in 2017 with your new accordion and viola piece. It would be nice to talk more about it over email, so please just send me a message. Thanks and hope to hear from you soon! Gordon Williamson )

item.title: Pascale Jakubowski - 2016-09-10 09:04:56
item.content:encoded: Bonjour Clara Iannotta. Je suis compositrice et professeur de composition en France près de Lyon. http://pascalejakubowski.com/en/welcome/. Je vais présenter et analyser Al di la del bianco jeudi prochain dans ma classe: caractères, forme, timbre, rythmes, motifs récurrents et évolutifs, couleurs harmoniques... Auriez-vous la gentillesse de me faire parvenir quelques mots sur cette oeuvre, notamment à propos d'éléments qui ne sont pas visibles sur la partition: vos propres intentions, le contexte pour l'interprétation, ce que vous souhaiteriez entendre mieux lors d'un prochain enregistrement (souffle?). Je vous remercie pour votre attention et votre aide. Bien cordialement. Pascale Jakubowski <!--more--> AUTHOR: Pascale Jakubowski AUTHOR EMAIL: pascale.jakubowski@orange.fr AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 92.137.155.61 Array ( [Name] => Pascale Jakubowski [E-mail Address] => pascale.jakubowski@orange.fr [Message] => Bonjour Clara Iannotta. Je suis compositrice et professeur de composition en France près de Lyon. http://pascalejakubowski.com/en/welcome/. Je vais présenter et analyser Al di la del bianco jeudi prochain dans ma classe: caractères, forme, timbre, rythmes, motifs récurrents et évolutifs, couleurs harmoniques... Auriez-vous la gentillesse de me faire parvenir quelques mots sur cette oeuvre, notamment à propos d'éléments qui ne sont pas visibles sur la partition: vos propres intentions, le contexte pour l'interprétation, ce que vous souhaiteriez entendre mieux lors d'un prochain enregistrement (souffle?). Je vous remercie pour votre attention et votre aide. Bien cordialement. Pascale Jakubowski )

item.title: Daiko Fujikawa - 2016-09-11 16:46:55
item.content:encoded: Nice to e-meet you. I'm studying composition in Tokyo University of the Arts. I ordered two scores(Intent on Resurrection — Spring or Some Such Thing , Limun) in this site in 25 July, but the email haven't been delivered yet. So, could you check it again, please? <!--more--> AUTHOR: Daiko Fujikawa AUTHOR EMAIL: daikofujikawa.426@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 219.109.229.92 Array ( [Name] => Daiko Fujikawa [E-mail Address] => daikofujikawa.426@gmail.com [Message] => Nice to e-meet you. item.title: Ipke Starke - 2016-09-13 22:26:25
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta, I'd like to inform you about our vacancy in composition (W3):
http://www.hmt-leipzig.de/home/hochschule/vakanzen/info_125254/W3_Professur_fur_Komposition_HMT_Leipzig.pdf
It would be great if you were interested.
All the best Ipke Starke (Head of department) <!--more--> AUTHOR: Ipke Starke AUTHOR EMAIL: ipke.starke@hmt-leipzig.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 217.84.202.115 Array ( [Name] => Ipke Starke [E-mail Address] => ipke.starke@hmt-leipzig.de [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta, I'd like to inform you about our vacancy in composition (W3):
http://www.hmt-leipzig.de/home/hochschule/vakanzen/info_125254/W3_Professur_fur_Komposition_HMT_Leipzig.pdf

item.title: Jacques Tchamkerten - 2016-09-21 15:59:34
item.content:encoded:
Dear Mrs Iannota, We would like to buy the score and parts from your your work : D'après. This work will be played by students from the Geneva HEM (High School of Music) conducted by Mrs Elena Schwarz.. The concert will be held at the Grand salle of the Conservatory of Geneva on December 16th, 2016. Unfortunately, we cannot use the Paypal system for the payment. So, could it be possible to pay you by bank transfer? In this case, could you send me by PDF an invoice with all your bank references? Our exact address is :
Haute Ecole de Musique de Genève Bibliothèque – att . Jacques Tchamkerten 12 Rue de l’Arquebuse CH-1205 Genève (Switzerland)
Soon as I receive this informations we will do the payment. Looking forward for hearing from you soon,. Best regards.
Jacques Tchamkerten Librarian, HEM-Conservatoire de Musique de Genève <!--more--> AUTHOR: Jacques Tchamkerten AUTHOR EMAIL: jacques.tchamkerten@cmg.ch AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 129.194.206.67 Array ( [Name] => Jacques Tchamkerten [E-mail Address] => jacques.tchamkerten@cmg.ch [Message] => Dear Mrs Iannota, We would like to buy the score and parts from your your work : D'après. This work will be played by students from the Geneva HEM (High School of Music) conducted by Mrs Elena Schwarz.. The concert will be held at the Grand salle of the Conservatory of Geneva on December 16th, 2016. Unfortunately, we cannot use the Paypal system for the payment. So, could it be possible to pay you by bank transfer? In this case, could you send me by PDF an invoice with all your bank references? Our exact address is :
Haute Ecole de Musique de Genève Bibliothèque – att . Jacques Tchamkerten 12 Rue de l’Arquebuse CH-1205 Genève (Switzerland)
Soon as I receive this informations we will do the payment. Looking forward for hearing from you soon,. Best regards.
Jacques Tchamkerten Librarian, HEM-Conservatoire de Musique de Genève
)

item.title: Jessica Frey - 2016-09-30 23:26:14
item.content:encoded:
Hi Clara,
I represent Ariadne Music Resources, the mechanical licensing subsidiary to Naxos of America, and our recent mechanical licensing catalog contains an album with your work titled “Dead Wasps in the Jam-jar.” Please respond confirming who owns the copyright to this work so I may follow up with a mechanical license to the respective party.
Lastly, do not hesitate to contact with any questions or concerns you may have.
Best, Jessica Frey Royalty Admin. Assistant Naxos of America <!--more--> AUTHOR: Jessica Frey AUTHOR EMAIL: jfrey@naxosusa.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 4.31.144.162 Array ( [Name] => Jessica Frey [E-mail Address] => jfrey@naxosusa.com [Message] => Hi Clara,
I represent Ariadne Music Resources, the mechanical licensing subsidiary to Naxos of America, and our recent mechanical licensing catalog contains an album with your work titled “Dead Wasps in the Jam-jar.” Please respond confirming who owns the copyright to this work so I may follow up with a mechanical license to the respective party.
Lastly, do not hesitate to contact with any questions or concerns you may have.
Best, Jessica Frey Royalty Admin. Assistant Naxos of America )

a:4:{s:2:"to";a:1:{i:0;s:24:"clara.iannotta@gmail.com";}s:7:"subject";s:36:"Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com";s:7:"message";s:739:"Name: Jessica Frey E-mail Address: jfrey@naxosusa.com : Message: Hi Clara,
I represent Ariadne Music Resources, the mechanical licensing subsidiary to Naxos of America, and our recent mechanical licensing catalog contains an album with your work titled “Dead Wasps in the Jam-jar.” Please respond confirming who owns the copyright to this work so I may follow up with a mechanical license to the respective party.
Lastly, do not hesitate to contact with any questions or concerns you may have.
Best, Jessica Frey Royalty Admin. Assistant Naxos of America
Time: Friday September 30, 2016 at 11:26 pm IP Address: 4.31.144.162 Contact Form URL: http://claraiannotta.com/contact/

item.title: steven heelein - 2016-10-02 17:15:32
item.content:encoded: Dear Clara, my name is Steven Heelein, i'm professor for conducting at the churchmusic colleges Bayreuth and Regensburg. Since 2004 i work as composer. Is it possible to send you some scores for Bludenz? Kindly, steven. www.sheelein.de <!--more--> AUTHOR: steven heelein AUTHOR EMAIL: sheelein@yahoo.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 91.2.248.254 Array ( [Name] => steven heelein [E-mail Address] => sheelein@yahoo.de [Message] => Dear Clara, my name is Steven Heelein, i'm professor for conducting at the churchmusic colleges Bayreuth and Regensburg. Since 2004 i work as composer. Is it possible to send you some scores for Bludenz? Kindly, steven. www.sheelein.de )

item.title: Michaela Wiesbeck - 2016-10-14 13:04:57
item.content:encoded: Dear Clara, we met yesterday at the Prinzregententheater and I did the recording of your Piece. Congratulations again for yesterdays uccess!! Listening again right now, I wonder (again and now sure) that my score at figure "N" is not what I hear. the tupperware from "M" goes on until the Sinus at 232 Comes in - is that new? And I cnat hear the Cellos and bases at 213-215. Can you tell me if there were changes in the score or if that was not so well played? just to know for our Archive. Best! Michaela <!--more--> AUTHOR: Michaela Wiesbeck AUTHOR EMAIL: michaela.wiesbeck@br.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 194.187.160.94 Array ( [Name] => Michaela Wiesbeck [E-mail Address] => michaela.wiesbeck@br.de [Message] => Dear Clara, we met yesterday at the Prinzregententheater and I did the recording of your Piece. Listening again right now, I wonder (again and now sure) that my score at figure "N" is not what I hear. the tupperware from "M" goes on until the Sinus at 232 Comes in - is that new? And I cnat hear the Cellos and bases at 213-215. Can you tell me if there were changes in the score or if that was not so well played? just to know for our Archive. Best! Michaela )

item.title: Andreas Anzeneder - 2016-10-23 11:57:09
item.content:encoded: Dear Clara! I've read in the MKO programme about your wasp composition, which I unfortunately missed on B4 Klassik last week. I adore Fritz Wunderlich, the great German tenor, who also sangvery much modern Music, i.e. at Hitzacker. Best regards, Andreas Anzeneder, portrait painter. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Andreas Anzeneder AUTHOR EMAIL: andreas.anzeneder@web.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 46.244.243.16 Array ( [Name] => Andreas Anzeneder [E-mail Address] => andreas.anzeneder@web.de [Message] => Dear Clara! I've read in the MKO programme about your wasp composition, which I unfortunately missed on B4 Klassik last week. I adore Fritz Wunderlich, the great German tenor, who also sangvery much modern Music, i.e. at Hitzacker. Best regards, Andreas Anzeneder, portrait painter. )

item.title: Magnus Andersson - 2016-11-15 10:02:45
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara, I am Magnus Andersson, a guitarist, from Sweden. The Italian Institute in Stockholm has asked me many times to make suggestions for what to put for new music in their various series of concerts. Last spring I did a small series that I called Specchi Italiani. I have a simple question. Would it be possible to put together a recital of your music with a group of 7 player with a repertoire from 1 to 7 instruments? The instrumentation is violin, viola, cello, flute, clarinet, piano and percussion? Let me know soon. We have a professional ensemble here in Sweden and I would like to see if I can involve them sooner or later for a portrait. I know I ought tomdo the rewearch myself, but I do this on my free time, and you surely will be able to answer this question quicker than I. I am a good friend of Chaya and Josh Levine, but I am not sure if our paths crossed.
Best Magnus <!--more--> AUTHOR: Magnus Andersson AUTHOR EMAIL: perotto@mac.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 80.217.70.68 Array ( [Name] => Magnus Andersson [E-mail Address] => perotto@mac.com [Message] => Dear Clara, I am Magnus Andersson, a guitarist, from Sweden. The Italian Institute in Stockholm has asked me many times to make suggestions for what to put for new music in their various series of concerts. Last spring I did a small series that I called Specchi Italiani. I have a simple question. Would it be possible to put together a recital of your music with a group of 7 player with a repertoire from 1 to 7 instruments? The instrumentation is violin, viola, cello, flute, clarinet, piano and percussion? Let me know soon. We have a professional ensemble here in Sweden and I would like to see if I can involve them sooner or later for a portrait. I know I ought tomdo the rewearch myself, but I do this on my free time, and you surely will be able to answer this question quicker than I. I am a good friend of Chaya and Josh Levine, but I am not sure if our paths crossed.
Best Magnus
)

item.title: Magnus Andersson - 2016-11-19 12:16:03
item.content:encoded:
Cara Clara, ho scritto a te poco tempo fa per suggerire un ritratto sul te a l'Istituto di cultura Italiana in Stoccolma in 2017. Hai letto? Sono un po in stretta. Ho studiato tua l "work list". Repertorio non sara una problema credo. Normalmente il compositore venga per il concerto,; un intervista e forse anche un seminario.
A presto Magnus Andersson <!--more--> AUTHOR: Magnus Andersson AUTHOR EMAIL: perotto@mac.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 80.217.70.68 Array ( [Name] => Magnus Andersson [E-mail Address] => perotto@mac.com [Message] => Cara Clara, ho scritto a te poco tempo fa per suggerire un ritratto sul te a l'Istituto di cultura Italiana in Stoccolma in 2017. Hai letto? Sono un po in stretta. Ho studiato tua l "work list". Repertorio non sara una problema credo. Normalmente il compositore venga per il concerto,; un intervista e forse anche un seminario.
A presto Magnus Andersson
)

item.title: Andrea Beggio - 2016-11-19 18:40:52
item.content:encoded:
Carissima Clara, sto scrivendo la tesi per il biennio di musica elettronica al Conservatorio Monteverdi il cui titolo sarà: Scolpire il Suono. L'argomento che sto trattando cerca di contestualizzare le esperienze musicali in cui le questioni legate al suono si fanno largo nel mondo musicale contemporaneo. Dopo un primo inquadramento storico cerco di introdurre e descrivere l'esperienza spettrale e arrivare fino ai giorni nostri. Una questione che sta sempre alla base delle varie riflessioni è quella legata alle tecnologie e al loro esponenziale sviluppo (analisi spettrale, Computer aided composition, computer aided orchestration, ecc). Poiché arrivare ai giorni nostri significa scontrarsi con un'assenza cronica di bibliografia, ho pensato di contattare direttamente i compositori che mi sembra possano essere sensibili alle questioni e porgli direttamente un quesito. La domanda in questione è stata presa da un passo del testo di Dufourt, musica, potere e scrittura ( ed. LIM, pag 323) ed è a mio giudizio un'ottima domanda perché permette di chiarire in modo chiaro e definitivo tutte le necessità espressive di chi "compone i suoni", rispetto anche alle molte critiche di certa musicologia. Poiché il tuo contributo sarebbe di grande valore, riporto qui di seguito il quesito sperando che la tua risposta (che non serve sia estremamente lunga) possa far parte del mio lavoro. Cordiali saluti Andrea Beggio
DOMANDA: Secondo gli esperti, la ricerca di nuove risorse sonore - per l’orchestra, il sintetizzatore o il calcolatore - tradisce un malessere e sancisce in ogni caso il fallimento delle grandi ambizioni.
E’ questo un sintomo di indigenza, di rassegnazione? La prospettiva tecnologica interverrebbe laddove è venuta meno la capacità di creare e di ragionare? In che modo la tua musica si pone rispetto a tali questioni? <!--more--> AUTHOR: Andrea Beggio AUTHOR EMAIL: and70it@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 46.18.27.14 Array ( [Name] => Andrea Beggio [E-mail Address] => and70it@gmail.com [Message] => Carissima Clara, sto scrivendo la tesi per il biennio di musica elettronica al Conservatorio Monteverdi il cui titolo sarà: Scolpire il Suono. Dopo un primo inquadramento storico cerco di introdurre e descrivere l'esperienza spettrale e arrivare fino ai giorni nostri. Una questione che sta sempre alla base delle varie riflessioni è quella legata alle tecnologie e al loro esponenziale sviluppo (analisi spettrale, Computer aided composition, computer aided orchestration, ecc). Poiché arrivare ai giorni nostri significa scontrarsi con un'assenza cronica di bibliografia, ho pensato di contattare direttamente i compositori che mi sembra possano essere sensibili alle questioni e porgli direttamente un quesito. La domanda in questione è stata presa da un passo del testo di Dufourt, musica, potere e scrittura ( ed. LIM, pag 323) ed è a mio giudizio un'ottima domanda perché permette di chiarire in modo chiaro e definitivo tutte le necessità espressive di chi "compone i suoni", rispetto anche alle molte critiche di certa musicologia. Poiché il tuo contributo sarebbe di grande valore, riporto qui di seguito il quesito sperando che la tua risposta (che non serve sia estremamente lunga) possa far parte del mio lavoro. Cordiali saluti Andrea Beggio
DOMANDA: Secondo gli esperti, la ricerca di nuove risorse sonore - per l’orchestra, il sintetizzatore o il calcolatore - tradisce un malessere e sancisce in ogni caso il fallimento delle grandi ambizioni.
E’ questo un sintomo di indigenza, di rassegnazione? La prospettiva tecnologica interverrebbe laddove è venuta meno la capacità di creare e di ragionare? In che modo la tua musica si pone rispetto a tali questioni? )

item.title: Carl Traverse - 2016-11-29 20:13:55
item.content:encoded:
Hi Clara,
My name is Carl. You've been very generous sending me some music in the past.
I was wondering if it would be possible to listen to a recording and follow along with a score for your orchestral work "dead wasps in the jam-jar (ii)"? This would be for personal use only.
Thank you for your time, Carl <!--more--> AUTHOR: Carl Traverse AUTHOR EMAIL: traversecarl@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 128.36.7.168 Array ( [Name] => Carl Traverse [E-mail Address] => traversecarl@gmail.com [Message] => Hi Clara,
My name is Carl. You've been very generous sending me some music in the past.
I was wondering if it would be possible to listen to a recording and follow along with a score for your orchestral work "dead wasps in the jam-jar (ii)"? This would be for personal use only.
Thank you for your time, Carl )

item.title: Pierre Fournier - 2016-12-01 21:08:59
item.content:encoded:
Bonjour Clara, Je souhaiterai savoir si il est possible d'écouter la pièce "dead wasps in the jam-jar (ii)" comme il est proposé sur le site ? D'autres part la partition de cette pièce m'intéresserai aussi est-elle disponible bientôt, je l'achèterai comme toutes les autres !
Merci et encore bravo pour toutes cette musique incroyable et poétique que tu composes !
Merci d'avance, A bientôt, Pierre Fournier. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Pierre Fournier AUTHOR EMAIL: pierrefclar@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 87.91.102.91 Array ( [Name] => Pierre Fournier [E-mail Address] => pierrefclar@gmail.com [Message] => Bonjour Clara, Je souhaiterai savoir si il est possible d'écouter la pièce "dead wasps in the jam-jar (ii)" comme il est proposé sur le site ? D'autres part la partition de cette pièce m'intéresserai aussi est-elle disponible bientôt, je l'achèterai comme toutes les autres !
Merci et encore bravo pour toutes cette musique incroyable et poétique que tu composes !
Merci d'avance, A bientôt, Pierre Fournier. )

item.title: Theresa Beyer - 2016-12-05 11:33:29
item.content:encoded:
Cara Clara,
sono Theresa, redattrice di musica da Radio Federale Svizzera SRF 2 Kultur e mi piacerebbe presentare lei e la Sua musica nel nostro formato "Musik unserer Zeit". Sto pensando della mia prossima trasmissione del 4 Gennaio.
Vorrei incontrarLa in persona e spero che sia possibile ancora prima di natale.
Lei forse per caso passa a Basilea o Berna i prossimi giorni? Io, il 9, 10 e il 21 di dicembre sono a Milano, il 22 e il 26-30 a Berlino. C'é una possibilità di vederci? Se no, possimao anche trovare un appuntamento e fare l'intervista via Skype.
Mi può anche volentieri chiamare: 0041 76 241 46 33
Cordialmente,
Theresa Beyer
Musikredaktorin Radio SRF 2 Kultur http://www.srf.ch/sendungen/musik-unserer-zeit <!--more--> AUTHOR: Theresa Beyer AUTHOR EMAIL: theresa.beyer@srf.ch AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 146.159.132.2 Array ( [Name] => Theresa Beyer [E-mail Address] => theresa.beyer@srf.ch [Message] => Cara Clara,

Vorrei incontrarLa in persona e spero che sia possibile ancora prima di natale.
Lei forse per caso passa a Basilea o Berna i prossimi giorni? Io, il 9, 10 e il 21 di dicembre sono a Milano, il 22 e il 26-30 a Berlino. C'é una possibilità di vederci? Se no, possimao anche trovare un appuntamento e fare l'intervista via Skype.
Mi può anche volentieri chiamare: 0041 76 241 46 33
Cordialmente,
Theresa Beyer
Musikredaktorin Radio SRF 2 Kultur http://www.srf.ch/sendungen/musik-unserer-zeit
)

Theresa Beyer

item.title: Miguel Szekely Aburto - 2016-12-08 01:04:09
item.content:encoded:
Hello Clara,
My name is Miguel Szekely Aburto, I am from Mexico City and I study at Berklee college of music. I am majoring in Contemporary Writing and Production and Professional Music where I am focusing on Guitar Performance, Conducting and Composition. This semester I took a class on history of contemporary Music taught by Composer and Professor Marti Epstein. I was assigned to do a presentation on your work as my final project so I was wondering if I could ask you a couple of questions over E-mail or through here so that I can talk better about your music and your creative process. I understand that you are very busy but I would be very gratefull if I could contact you.
Thank you very much,
Miguel <!--more--> AUTHOR: Miguel Szekely Aburto AUTHOR EMAIL: mszekelyaburto@berklee.edu AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 73.69.62.126 Array ( [Name] => Miguel Szekely Aburto [E-mail Address] => mszekelyaburto@berklee.edu [Message] => Hello Clara,
My name is Miguel Szekely Aburto, I am from Mexico City and I study at Berklee college of music. I am majoring in Contemporary Writing and Production and Professional Music where I am focusing on Guitar Performance, Conducting and Composition. This semester I took a class on history of contemporary Music taught by Composer and Professor Marti Epstein. I was assigned to do a presentation on your work as my final project so I was wondering if I could ask you a couple of questions over E-mail or through here so that I can talk better about your music and your creative process. I understand that you are very busy but I would be very gratefull if I could contact you.
Thank you very much,
Miguel )

item.title: hans schneider - 2016-12-15 17:35:20
item.content:encoded: http://suono.at/wordpress/produkt/waldteufel/ hallo clara, das ist die seite mit den besonders guten waldteufelchen! vielen dank für die cd, den schönen abend im konzerthaus mit toller musik! when my book is finished, I will tell you! with best whises hans <!--more--> AUTHOR: hans schneider AUTHOR EMAIL: h.schneider@mh-freiburg.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 188.23.12.65 Array ( [Name] => hans schneider [E-mail Address] => h.schneider@mh-freiburg.de [Message] => http://suono.at/wordpress/produkt/waldteufel/ hallo clara, das ist die seite mit den besonders guten waldteufelchen! vielen dank für die cd, den schönen abend im konzerthaus mit toller musik! when my book is finished, I will tell you! with best whises hans )

item.title: Andrew Stock - 2016-12-23 02:36:02
item.content:encoded:
Dear Ms. Iannotta,
I hope this finds you well. I know a small portion of your music (I am very fond of "limun") and am writing to ask to hear your recent string orchestra piece "dead wasps in the jam jar (ii)" as you suggest at the relevant page on your website. Thanks for your time!
Best regards, Andrew Stock <!--more--> AUTHOR: Andrew Stock AUTHOR EMAIL: andrewstockmusic@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 99.177.219.171 Array ( [Name] => Andrew Stock [E-mail Address] => andrewstockmusic@gmail.com [Message] => Dear Ms. Iannotta,
I hope this finds you well. I know a small portion of your music (I am very fond of "limun") and am writing to ask to hear your recent string orchestra piece "dead wasps in the jam jar (ii)" as you suggest at the relevant page on your website. Thanks for your time!
Best regards, Andrew Stock
)

item.title: sidney corbett - 2016-12-31 13:56:53
item.content:encoded: dear clara ianotta, we have not to my knowledge met but I very much like your work. I was wondering if you might be interested in coming to the hochschule in mannheim to meet with my composition class. If so we can discuss when and what the details might be. I get to Berlin regularly so maybe we could meet up if you were interested. All best to you in the new year and I hope to hear from you. With best wishes, Sidney Corbett here is my contact info: info@sidneycorbett.de tel (0176) 831 23 525 <!--more--> AUTHOR: sidney corbett AUTHOR EMAIL: info@sidneycorbett.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 89.14.82.164 Array ( [Name] => sidney corbett [E-mail Address] => info@sidneycorbett.de [Message] => dear clara ianotta, we have not to my knowledge met but I very much like your work. I was wondering if you might be interested in coming to the hochschule in mannheim to meet with my composition class. If so we can discuss when and what the details might be. I get to Berlin regularly so maybe we could meet up if you were interested. All best to you in the new year and I hope to hear from you. With best wishes, Sidney Corbett here is my contact info: info@sidneycorbett.de tel (0176) 831 23 525 )

item.title: SRF Kultur - 2017-01-09 15:23:43
item.content:encoded:
Hello Clara
Tomorrow, we will broadcast a programme about you on the Swiss radio station "Radio SRF 2 Kultur". At the same time we will also publish an online article about you. For this we would need a picture of you - is it ok if we use this one: http://claraiannotta.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/02/Iannotta_copyright-Chris-Swithinbank.jpg - we will put "Chris Swithinbank" as copyright.
Kind regards Tom Hägler Producer, SRF Kultur <!--more--> AUTHOR: SRF Kultur AUTHOR EMAIL: kulturonline.produzent@srf.ch AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 146.159.132.2 Array ( [Name] => SRF Kultur [E-mail Address] => kulturonline.produzent@srf.ch [Message] => Hello Clara

item.title: Asterios - 2017-02-05 16:08:58
item.content:encoded:
Hey. How is everything going? I'm Asterios and I'm a producer. I really like working with other musicians and I love your music. Been thinking about emailing you for a while. Would you like to work on a project together?
Kindest regards,
Asterios

item.title: Samuel Taylor - 2017-02-11 16:36:08
item.content:encoded: Hi Clara. I'm a student in Frédéric Durieux's class at CNSMDP. I really like your music and would be very interested in talking about your compositional path and your current musical interests with you. I've been spending CNSMDP's February break in Boston so I was wondering whether you'd have a small amount of time to get a coffee and talk about your music? I'm currently in Atlanta for the weekend, but will be back in Boston from Sunday until Tuesday. Would you possibly have an hour or so to spare on Monday? <!--more--> AUTHOR: Samuel Taylor AUTHOR EMAIL: samtaylorcomposer@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 107.213.142.170 Array ( [Name] => Samuel Taylor [E-mail Address] => samtaylorcomposer@gmail.com [Message] => Hi Clara. I'm a student in Frédéric Durieux's class at CNSMDP. I really like your music and would be very interested in talking about your compositional path and your current musical interests with you. I've been spending CNSMDP's February break in Boston so I was wondering whether you'd have a small amount of time to get a coffee and talk about your music? I'm currently in Atlanta for the weekend, but will be back in Boston from Sunday until Tuesday. Would you possibly have an hour or so to spare on Monday? )

item.title: Hanspeter Frick - 2017-02-17 15:04:28
item.content:encoded: Sehr geehrte Frau Clara Iannotta! Als Gründer und "Erfinder" der b.t.z.m. (erstmals im Januar 1987, u.a. mit Vielrteltonkompositioinen von G.F. Haas, Haba und Wyschnegradsky) erlaube ich mir, Ihnen ein Kompliment vor allem bezüglich der polyästhetischen Programmierung auszusprechen. Ich war auch Gründeungsobmann des Vereins Allerart und weiss die Genre - übergreifende Orpgrammierung als ursprünglich beabsichtigt zu schätzen. Gleichzeitig möchte ich Sie auch auf ein prämiertes Projekt hinweisen, welches es durchaus verdienen würde, bei den nächsten b.z.t.m. aufgeführt zu werden. ich selbst habe die faszinierende Uraufführung in Graz (Forum Stadtpark) miterlebt. Ein damit verbundener Vorteil wäre noch gegeben dadurch, dass Simon Frick, ein inzwischen hierzulande bekannter Geiger in Jazz und Zeitgenössischen Richtungen, mit von der Partie wäre und dadurch auch auf das gesamte Projekt hinweisen und somit Interessenten anziehen würde. Einen Eindruck können Sie bei folgender Seite gewinnen: http://www.denovaire.at/wordpress/?page_id=4947 Ich würde mich freuen, von Ihre Eindrück dazu zu erfahren und o Sie daran denken, das Projekt einzuplanen. Wegen der Finanzierung könnten Sie dann direkt der Projektleiter mit Ihnen in Kontakt treten. Mit freundlichen Grüßen und besten Wünschen Hanspeter Frick <!--more--> AUTHOR: Hanspeter Frick AUTHOR EMAIL: hanspeter.frick@aon.at AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 188.23.65.219 Array ( [Name] => Hanspeter Frick [E-mail Address] => hanspeter.frick@aon.at [Message] => Sehr geehrte Frau Clara Iannotta! Als Gründer und "Erfinder" der b.t.z.m. (erstmals im Januar 1987, u.a. mit Vielrteltonkompositioinen von G.F. Haas, Haba und Wyschnegradsky) erlaube ich mir, Ihnen ein Kompliment vor allem bezüglich der polyästhetischen Programmierung auszusprechen. Ich war auch Gründeungsobmann des Vereins Allerart und weiss die Genre - übergreifende Orpgrammierung als ursprünglich beabsichtigt zu schätzen. Gleichzeitig möchte ich Sie auch auf ein prämiertes Projekt hinweisen, welches es durchaus verdienen würde, bei den nächsten b.z.t.m. aufgeführt zu werden. ich selbst habe die faszinierende Uraufführung in Graz (Forum Stadtpark) miterlebt. Ein damit verbundener Vorteil wäre noch gegeben dadurch, dass Simon Frick, ein inzwischen hierzulande bekannter Geiger in Jazz und Zeitgenössischen Richtungen, mit von der Partie wäre und dadurch auch auf das gesamte Projekt hinweisen und somit Interessenten anziehen würde. Einen Eindruck können Sie bei folgender Seite gewinnen: http://www.denovaire.at/wordpress/?page_id=4947 Ich würde mich freuen, von Ihre Eindrück dazu zu erfahren und o Sie daran denken, das Projekt einzuplanen. Wegen der Finanzierung könnten Sie dann direkt der Projektleiter mit Ihnen in Kontakt treten. Mit freundlichen Grüßen und besten Wünschen Hanspeter Frick )

a:3:{s:4:"Name";s:15:"Hanspeter Frick";s:14:"E-mail Address";s:22:"hanspeter.frick@aon.at";s:7:"Message";s:1337:"Sehr geehrte Frau Clara Iannotta! Als Gründer und "Erfinder" der b.t.z.m. (erstmals im Januar 1987, u.a. mit Vielrteltonkompositioinen von G.F. Haas, Haba und Wyschnegradsky) erlaube ich mir, Ihnen ein Kompliment vor allem bezüglich der polyästhetischen Programmierung auszusprechen. Ich war auch Gründeungsobmann des Vereins Allerart und weiss die Genre - übergreifende Orpgrammierung als ursprünglich beabsichtigt zu schätzen. Gleichzeitig möchte ich Sie auch auf ein prämiertes Projekt hinweisen, welches es durchaus verdienen würde, bei den nächsten b.z.t.m. aufgeführt zu werden. ich selbst habe die faszinierende Uraufführung in Graz (Forum Stadtpark) miterlebt. Ein damit verbundener Vorteil wäre noch gegeben dadurch, dass Simon Frick, ein inzwischen hierzulande bekannter Geiger in Jazz und Zeitgenössischen Richtungen, mit von der Partie wäre und dadurch auch auf das gesamte Projekt hinweisen und somit Interessenten anziehen würde. Einen Eindruck können Sie bei folgender Seite gewinnen: http://www.denovaire.at/wordpress/?page_id=4947 Ich würde mich freuen, von Ihre Eindrück dazu zu erfahren und o Sie daran denken, das Projekt einzuplanen. Wegen der Finanzierung könnten Sie dann direkt der Projektleiter mit Ihnen in Kontakt treten. Mit freundlichen Grüßen und besten Wünschen Hanspeter Frick";}

item.title: Martha Cargo - 2017-02-19 12:20:37
item.content:encoded: Hi Clara! I just saw your piece in VAN Magazine on Chaya's new opera. I tweet for I CARE IF YOU LISTEN. Brava! I'm a NYC-based flutist, and would love it if you could send me any scores involving flute (interesting that you trained for many years as a flutist, but haven't written anything predominantly featuring it...) - more on my projects on my site: http://www.marthacargo.com <!--more--> AUTHOR: Martha Cargo AUTHOR EMAIL: m.ellencargo@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 24.186.241.52 Array ( [Name] => Martha Cargo [E-mail Address] => m.ellencargo@gmail.com [Message] => Hi Clara! item.title: Julia Blondeau - 2017-02-24 13:20:48
item.content:encoded:
Salut Clara,
Je ne sais pas si tu te souviens de moi, on s'était vu à Harvard en 2014 (le temps passe vite...) pendant l'été. Je te contacte parce que j'envisage d'organiser des rencontres, si possibles pas trop formelles, entre jeunes compositeurs, pour parler... composition ! A paris, peut-être à l'Ircam (pour simplifier la logistique), mais en "off"... Ce serait super si tu pouvais venir. Pour l'instant il n'y a pas de dates précises (ce ne serait pas avant juillet de cette année de toute façon), mais j'aimerais déjà savoir si tu serais intéressée. Il y a très peu de lieux/moments de discussion je trouve à Paris depuis quelques temps et je trouve ça très dommage... Bref, dis moi ce que tu en penses et si tu as des noms d'autres compositeurs aussi éventuellement. Je trouve plutôt bien qu'on puisse discuter alors même que nous avons des esthétiques un peu différentes.
Bon je m'arrêtes là et te dis (peut-être !) à bientôt. Par ailleurs, bravo pour ta pièce "Troglodytes" que j'ai trouvé vraiment super !
julia <!--more--> AUTHOR: Julia Blondeau AUTHOR EMAIL: julia.blondeau1986@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 82.67.244.232 Array ( [Name] => Julia Blondeau [E-mail Address] => julia.blondeau1986@gmail.com [Message] => Salut Clara,

Pour l'instant il n'y a pas de dates précises (ce ne serait pas avant juillet de cette année de toute façon), mais j'aimerais déjà savoir si tu serais intéressée. Il y a très peu de lieux/moments de discussion je trouve à Paris depuis quelques temps et je trouve ça très dommage... Bref, dis moi ce que tu en penses et si tu as des noms d'autres compositeurs aussi éventuellement. Je trouve plutôt bien qu'on puisse discuter alors même que nous avons des esthétiques un peu différentes.
Bon je m'arrêtes là et te dis (peut-être !) à bientôt. Par ailleurs, bravo pour ta pièce "Troglodytes" que j'ai trouvé vraiment super !
julia )

item.title: Maggie Stapleton - 2017-03-03 02:48:59
item.content:encoded:
Hello!
My name is Maggie Stapleton and I work at Second Inversion, a 24/7 online stream, blog, and community dedicated to rethinking classical music with cross-genre and experimental new works.
One of your compositions is being featured during our 24-hour Women in (New) Music Marathon on Wednesday, March 8th in honor of International Women’s Day. We’d like to ask you to help us spread the word about the marathon and encourage your friends, fans, and colleagues to tune in to Second Inversion on March 8th to hear your music and discover more new works by other women composers from around the world. You can also go ahead and RSVP and invite your friends to our Facebook event for the marathon.
We would also like to invite you to be featured in an article we are compiling which asks women composers what advice they would give to other young women who are aspiring to take on creative leadership roles. This article will appear on our website as part of our Women in (New) Music series: an ongoing series which highlights feminist issues within and beyond the classical music sphere (click here to read the latest installments).
If you are interested in being featured in this article, please send us your response to the following question by Monday, March 6:
In what ways (if any) do you feel that being a woman has shaped your experiences as an artist? What advice do you have for other female-identifying artists who are aspiring to creative leadership roles?
We are looking forward to featuring your music (alongside the music of so many other influential women composers) on March 8th and all throughout the rest of the year as well!
Thank you for your time,
Maggie Stapleton Assistant Station Manager Classical KING FM 98.1 | www.KING.org Second Inversion | www.secondinversion.org 10 Harrison Street, Suite 100 | Seattle, WA 98109 Email: maggies@king.org Phone: (206) 691-2964 Fax: (206) 691-2982

My name is Maggie Stapleton and I work at Second Inversion, a 24/7 online stream, blog, and community dedicated to rethinking classical music with cross-genre and experimental new works.
One of your compositions is being featured during our 24-hour Women in (New) Music Marathon on Wednesday, March 8th in honor of International Women’s Day. We’d like to ask you to help us spread the word about the marathon and encourage your friends, fans, and colleagues to tune in to Second Inversion on March 8th to hear your music and discover more new works by other women composers from around the world. You can also go ahead and RSVP and invite your friends to our Facebook event for the marathon.
We would also like to invite you to be featured in an article we are compiling which asks women composers what advice they would give to other young women who are aspiring to take on creative leadership roles. This article will appear on our website as part of our Women in (New) Music series: an ongoing series which highlights feminist issues within and beyond the classical music sphere (click here to read the latest installments).
If you are interested in being featured in this article, please send us your response to the following question by Monday, March 6:
In what ways (if any) do you feel that being a woman has shaped your experiences as an artist? What advice do you have for other female-identifying artists who are aspiring to creative leadership roles?
We are looking forward to featuring your music (alongside the music of so many other influential women composers) on March 8th and all throughout the rest of the year as well!
Thank you for your time,
Maggie Stapleton Assistant Station Manager Classical KING FM 98.1 | www.KING.org Second Inversion | www.secondinversion.org 10 Harrison Street, Suite 100 | Seattle, WA 98109 Email: maggies@king.org Phone: (206) 691-2964 Fax: (206) 691-2982
Enhancing a Community Treasure KING FM – Listener Supported Classical Music ";}

item.title: Fernando García Márquez (Spain) - 2017-03-07 00:49:31
item.content:encoded:
Buona sera. Sono un compositore spagnolo e volesse chiedergli se è possibile la partitura generale (PDF), per uso personale di dead wasps in the jam-jar (ii) (2016). Molte grazie ed auguri per la sua opera, è fantastica !. Cordiali saluti. Fernando García Márquez . <!--more--> AUTHOR: Fernando García Márquez (Spain) AUTHOR EMAIL: fermusik@hotmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 79.148.51.243 Array ( [Name] => Fernando García Márquez (Spain) [E-mail Address] => fermusik@hotmail.com [Message] => Buona sera. item.title: Giulio Colangelo ( LOXOSconcept) - 2017-03-07 17:55:42
item.content:encoded:
Gentile Clara Iannotta,
siamo Giulio Colangelo & Valerio De Bonis, compositori e artisti intermediali.
Il nostro collettivo artistico LOXOSconcept organizza la SECONDA edizione del MA/IN 2017 - MAtera INtermediafestival che si svolgerà a MATERA (4 - 9 Dicembre 2017).
La location principale del festival sarà CASA CAVA (http://www.casacava.it/tour/build/virtualtour.html), patrocinato dal Conservatorio di musica di Matera e in collaborazione col MUSMA (Museo della scultura Contemporanea).
In previsione di Matera Capitale Europea della Cultura 2019 s'intende organizzare annualmente un festival sperimentale nel cuore della città (Musica elettroacustica e acusmatica, installazioni sonore, esibizioni live Audiovisive, Live coding, workshop, masterclass etc).
E’ possibile visitare il sito www.materaintermedia.it per dare uno sguardo al programma della scorsa edizione e alla precedente giuria di selezione. Molto presto pubblicheremo anche il booklet con tutti i contenuti del MA/IN 2016 e i video delle varie performance.
Le chiediamo se vuole partecipare al nostro evento in qualità di giurato.
La giuria sarà composta da artisti e compositori internazionali e il processo di selezione consiste nella valutazione on-line di poche opere per ogni giurato (si ipotizza tra luglio e settembre 2017).
Di seguito le categorie : [A] Musica acusmatica, [B] mixed media (lavori per strumento/i + elettronica), [C] Audiovisivi, [D] installazioni sonore / live performance
Il MA/IN è un festival indipendente. Lo scopo è diffondere la cultura della nuova musica, con forte interesse verso la formazione e la produzione di nuove opere di musica sperimentale….ma on un budget minimo. L’ organizzazione del festival non è a scopo di lucro pertanto non siamo in grado di destinare una parte del budget ai giurati.
Ad ogni modo il nostro intento è quello di comporre una giuria di alto profilo internazionale in modo da garantire un festival di alta qualità (come siamo riusciti a fare per scorsa edizione).
Aspettiamo una sua risposta. per qualsiasi informazione La preghiamo di contattarci.
Cordiali Saluti -- LOXOSconcept Team ---------------------- |||||||| MA/IN 2017 || ---------------------- Giulio Colangelo /// giuliocolangelo.eu Valerio De Bonis /// nastromagnetico.wix.com/mysite Donato Corbo /// materaintermedia.it <!--more--> AUTHOR: Giulio Colangelo ( LOXOSconcept) AUTHOR EMAIL: info@LOXOSconcept.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 79.36.152.208 Array ( [Name] => Giulio Colangelo ( LOXOSconcept) [E-mail Address] => info@LOXOSconcept.com [Message] => Gentile Clara Iannotta,

L’ organizzazione del festival non è a scopo di lucro pertanto non siamo in grado di destinare una parte del budget ai giurati.
Ad ogni modo il nostro intento è quello di comporre una giuria di alto profilo internazionale in modo da garantire un festival di alta qualità (come siamo riusciti a fare per scorsa edizione).
Aspettiamo una sua risposta. per qualsiasi informazione La preghiamo di contattarci.

Lo scopo è diffondere la cultura della nuova musica, con forte interesse verso la formazione e la produzione di nuove opere di musica sperimentale….ma on un budget minimo. L’ organizzazione del festival non è a scopo di lucro pertanto non siamo in grado di destinare una parte del budget ai giurati.
Ad ogni modo il nostro intento è quello di comporre una giuria di alto profilo internazionale in modo da garantire un festival di alta qualità (come siamo riusciti a fare per scorsa edizione).
Aspettiamo una sua risposta. per qualsiasi informazione La preghiamo di contattarci.
Cordiali Saluti -- LOXOSconcept Team ---------------------- |||||||| MA/IN 2017 || ---------------------- Giulio Colangelo /// giuliocolangelo.eu Valerio De Bonis /// nastromagnetico.wix.com/mysite Donato Corbo /// materaintermedia.it";s:12:"comment_type";s:12:"contact_form";s:7:"user_ip";s:13:"79.36.152.208";s:10:"user_agent";s:117:"Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; a:4:{s:2:"to";a:1:{i:0;s:24:"clara.iannotta@gmail.com";}s:7:"subject";s:36:"Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com";s:7:"message";s:2654:"Name: Giulio Colangelo ( LOXOSconcept) E-mail Address: info@LOXOSconcept.com : Message: Gentile Clara Iannotta,
siamo Giulio Colangelo & Valerio De Bonis, compositori e artisti intermediali.
Il nostro collettivo artistico LOXOSconcept organizza la SECONDA edizione del MA/IN 2017 - MAtera INtermediafestival che si svolgerà a MATERA (4 - 9 Dicembre 2017).
La location principale del festival sarà CASA CAVA (http://www.casacava.it/tour/build/virtualtour.html), patrocinato dal Conservatorio di musica di Matera e in collaborazione col MUSMA (Museo della scultura Contemporanea).
In previsione di Matera Capitale Europea della Cultura 2019 s'intende organizzare annualmente un festival sperimentale nel cuore della città (Musica elettroacustica e acusmatica, installazioni sonore, esibizioni live Audiovisive, Live coding, workshop, masterclass etc).
E’ possibile visitare il sito www.materaintermedia.it per dare uno sguardo al programma della scorsa edizione e alla precedente giuria di selezione. Molto presto pubblicheremo anche il booklet con tutti i contenuti del MA/IN 2016 e i video delle varie performance.
Le chiediamo se vuole partecipare al nostro evento in qualità di giurato.
La giuria sarà composta da artisti e compositori internazionali e il processo di selezione consiste nella valutazione on-line di poche opere per ogni giurato (si ipotizza tra luglio e settembre 2017).
Di seguito le categorie : [A] Musica acusmatica, [B] mixed media (lavori per strumento/i + elettronica), [C] Audiovisivi, [D] installazioni sonore / live performance
Il MA/IN è un festival indipendente. Lo scopo è diffondere la cultura della nuova musica, con forte interesse verso la formazione e la produzione di nuove opere di musica sperimentale….ma on un budget minimo. L’ organizzazione del festival non è a scopo di lucro pertanto non siamo in grado di destinare una parte del budget ai giurati.
Ad ogni modo il nostro intento è quello di comporre una giuria di alto profilo internazionale in modo da garantire un festival di alta qualità (come siamo riusciti a fare per scorsa edizione).
Aspettiamo una sua risposta. per qualsiasi informazione La preghiamo di contattarci.
Cordiali Saluti -- LOXOSconcept Team ---------------------- |||||||| MA/IN 2017 || ---------------------- Giulio Colangelo /// giuliocolangelo.eu Valerio De Bonis /// nastromagnetico.wix.com/mysite Donato Corbo /// materaintermedia.it
Time: Tuesday March 7, 2017 at 5:55 pm IP Address: 79.36.152.208 Contact Form URL: http://claraiannotta.com/contact/

item.title: Ville Raasakka - 2017-03-10 08:15:52
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara,
We are performing your solo violin work and pianotrio in a concert in May in Helsinki, and the solo violin work would get further performances in the summer in Finland and Germany. Could we buy the performance materials from you? The link on your website for purchases doesn't seem to work. The concert is the debut of our new trio Tristero (Eriikka Maalismaa, violin, Markus Hohti, cello and Emil Holmström, piano).
Kindest regards, Ville Raasakka <!--more--> AUTHOR: Ville Raasakka AUTHOR EMAIL: ville.raasakka@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 91.159.205.95 Array ( [Name] => Ville Raasakka [E-mail Address] => ville.raasakka@gmail.com [Message] => Dear Clara,
We are performing your solo violin work and pianotrio in a concert in May in Helsinki, and the solo violin work would get further performances in the summer in Finland and Germany. Could we buy the performance materials from you? The link on your website for purchases doesn't seem to work. The concert is the debut of our new trio Tristero (Eriikka Maalismaa, violin, Markus Hohti, cello and Emil Holmström, piano).
Kindest regards, Ville Raasakka )

item.title: Annette Reisinger / Minguet Quartet - 2017-03-15 10:26:28
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta,
the Minguet Quartet - famous for the complete recordings of Rihm, Widmann and Ruzicka and others - would like to come in contact with you for a cooperation with the Bludenzer Tage zeitgemässer Musik 2018. http://www.festival-automne.com/edition-2016/wolfgang-rihm-et-lux#2964 https://www.elbphilharmonie.de/de/programm/minguet-quartett/7153
I'm happy to hear from you and to discuss about your themes and preferences.
Many thanks for your interest and all best wishes! Yours Annette Reisinger ____________________________________________________ Minguet Quartett Annette Reisinger & Angelika Pfohl Lütticher Str. 46 D - 50674 Köln
+49 - 221 - 589 11 59 annette.reisinger@minguet.de angelika.pfohl@minguet.de www.minguet.de <!--more--> AUTHOR: Annette Reisinger / Minguet Quartet AUTHOR EMAIL: annette.reisinger@minguet.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 88.152.8.131 Array ( [Name] => Annette Reisinger / Minguet Quartet [E-mail Address] => annette.reisinger@minguet.de [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta,

item.title: Sylvie Drouin Ensemble Aleph - 2017-03-15 16:19:26
item.content:encoded:
Chère Clara J'espère que tu vas bien et que ta carrière avance comme tu le veux? Nous aimerions éventuellement programmer la saison prochaine ton trio (entendu à Göteborg) pour violon, violoncelle et piano. Pourrais-tu m'envoyer le PDF? Nous aimerions aussi un trio clarinette basse, piano et boîtes à musique. Nous avons une réunion de programmation demain et aimerions avoir une idée. Merci de ta réponse rapide Amicalement Sylvie <!--more--> AUTHOR: Sylvie Drouin Ensemble Aleph AUTHOR EMAIL: sylviedrouinpiano@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 92.130.137.136 Array ( [Name] => Sylvie Drouin Ensemble Aleph [E-mail Address] => sylviedrouinpiano@gmail.com [Message] => Chère Clara J'espère que tu vas bien et que ta carrière avance comme tu le veux? Nous aimerions aussi un trio clarinette basse, piano et boîtes à musique. Nous avons une réunion de programmation demain et aimerions avoir une idée. Merci de ta réponse rapide Amicalement Sylvie
)

item.title: Sophia Miller - 2017-03-27 11:30:43
item.content:encoded: Dear Ms. Ianootta, I would like to inform you about the Celloduo Frank Schucan (Imke Frank/Martina Schucan) with regard to Bludenz Tage für Neue Musik. Would you mind giving me an E-Mail-address? item.title: Carin Levine - 2017-03-28 11:33:04
item.content:encoded: Dear Clara, I am looking for new Repertoire for my youth ensemble in Niedersachsen Ger. (I am the artistic director). I came across your piece "D'apres" that could fit our instrumentation. It is a beautiful piece, I enjoyed listening to is on your soundcloud. Would it be possible for you to send me a sample of the score? Of course if we can perform your piece we would purchase your score!! It would be wonderful to hear from you soon. I am a bit late asking and we are meeting these days to look at scores. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Carin Levine AUTHOR EMAIL: carinlevine09@googlemail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 2.162.110.44 Array ( [Name] => Carin Levine [E-mail Address] => carinlevine09@googlemail.com [Message] => Dear Clara, I am looking for new Repertoire for my youth ensemble in Niedersachsen Ger. (I am the artistic director). I came across your piece "D'apres" that could fit our instrumentation. It is a beautiful piece, I enjoyed listening to is on your soundcloud. Would it be possible for you to send me a sample of the score? Of course if we can perform your piece we would purchase your score!! It would be wonderful to hear from you soon. I am a bit late asking and we are meeting these days to look at scores. )

item.title: Henrique Rievers - 2017-03-28 11:56:06
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara,
My name is Henrique and I am currently finishing my PhD in Musicology at HU Berlin. The title of my dissertation is "Physiological Perspective of Avantgarde Music". My research had much to do with music as a physical experience. After listening to your music, I would very much like to talk to you about your views on the subject. For my dissertation I focused on older composers, like Kagel and Schnebel. But for my future research I would prefer to focus on how the younger generation, i.e. composers in their 30s, deal with this subject. If you are interested, I could send you a copy of my dissertation. One question: I already ordered the CD but is it possible to get scores from your works? where?
Hope to hear from you. And please let me knot if you are aware of more young composers that also work in this direction, I would greatly appreciate it.
Best regards,
Henrique Rievers <!--more--> AUTHOR: Henrique Rievers AUTHOR EMAIL: henriquerievers@gmal.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 77.12.47.178 Array ( [Name] => Henrique Rievers [E-mail Address] => henriquerievers@gmal.com [Message] => Dear Clara,
My name is Henrique and I am currently finishing my PhD in Musicology at HU Berlin. The title of my dissertation is "Physiological Perspective of Avantgarde Music". My research had much to do with music as a physical experience. After listening to your music, I would very much like to talk to you about your views on the subject. For my dissertation I focused on older composers, like Kagel and Schnebel. But for my future research I would prefer to focus on how the younger generation, i.e. composers in their 30s, deal with this subject. If you are interested, I could send you a copy of my dissertation. One question: I already ordered the CD but is it possible to get scores from your works? where?
Hope to hear from you. And please let me knot if you are aware of more young composers that also work in this direction, I would greatly appreciate it.
Best regards,
Henrique Rievers )

item.title: Richardson Smith - 2017-03-28 20:59:13
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara,
This is Richardson Smith from PARMA Recordings (www.parmarecordings.com) – I hope this message finds you well.
I’m writing because A&R Representative Brandon MacNeil and I came across your piece “dead wasps in the jam jar (ii)” and enjoyed listening. The choices you made between pitched and unpitched materials, the degree to which you had the ensemble play in unison, and the careful choices of timbre all add to the intense atmosphere of the piece – it’s a great listening experience.
I see that you released a solo album in 2013 – have you recently considered releasing another full-length work? I ask because we have a lot of experience with this and would like to talk with you about your music and goals.
In case you’re unfamiliar with our work, PARMA Recordings is a New England-based full-service music production company. Artists hire us to bring their music to life – from assembling the musicians in the recording studio all the way through marketing and distributing their albums. We are the parent company of four record labels: Navona, Ravello, Big Round, and Ansonica. Our labels are distributed nationwide through Naxos and feature artists such as Grammy-winner Libby Larsen, Pulitzer Prize-winner Lewis Spratlan, and Grammy-winner Richard Stoltzman.
Would you have time this week or early next for a quick phone call with Brandon and me? We’d like to hear more about your music and give you more context on PARMA and our services. Please let me know when would work best for you and I’ll set up a time for us to talk.
In the meantime, more information about what we do can be found in this short, behind-the-scenes video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5npaf-P_Fs.
We look forward to hearing from you.
All the best, Richardson <!--more--> AUTHOR: Richardson Smith AUTHOR EMAIL: richardson.smith@parmarecordings.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 173.46.110.235 Array ( [Name] => Richardson Smith [E-mail Address] => richardson.smith@parmarecordings.com [Message] => Dear Clara,
This is Richardson Smith from PARMA Recordings (www.parmarecordings.com) – I hope this message finds you well.
I’m writing because A&R Representative Brandon MacNeil and I came across your piece “dead wasps in the jam jar (ii)” and enjoyed listening. The choices you made between pitched and unpitched materials, the degree to which you had the ensemble play in unison, and the careful choices of timbre all add to the intense atmosphere of the piece – it’s a great listening experience.
I see that you released a solo album in 2013 – have you recently considered releasing another full-length work? I ask because we have a lot of experience with this and would like to talk with you about your music and goals.
In case you’re unfamiliar with our work, PARMA Recordings is a New England-based full-service music production company. Artists hire us to bring their music to life – from assembling the musicians in the recording studio all the way through marketing and distributing their albums. We are the parent company of four record labels: Navona, Ravello, Big Round, and Ansonica. Our labels are distributed nationwide through Naxos and feature artists such as Grammy-winner Libby Larsen, Pulitzer Prize-winner Lewis Spratlan, and Grammy-winner Richard Stoltzman.
Would you have time this week or early next for a quick phone call with Brandon and me? We’d like to hear more about your music and give you more context on PARMA and our services. Please let me know when would work best for you and I’ll set up a time for us to talk.
In the meantime, more information about what we do can be found in this short, behind-the-scenes video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5npaf-P_Fs.
We look forward to hearing from you.
All the best, Richardson
)

Our labels are distributed nationwide through Naxos and feature artists such as Grammy-winner Libby Larsen, Pulitzer Prize-winner Lewis Spratlan, and Grammy-winner Richard Stoltzman.
Would you have time this week or early next for a quick phone call with Brandon and me? We’d like to hear more about your music and give you more context on PARMA and our services. Please let me know when would work best for you and I’ll set up a time for us to talk.
In the meantime, more information about what we do can be found in this short, behind-the-scenes video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5npaf-P_Fs.
We look forward to hearing from you.
All the best, Richardson ";}

item.title: Emiliano Turazzi - 2017-04-04 12:14:44
item.content:encoded:
ciao Clara, ti mando un link soundcloud a l secondo movimento di una mia composizione per due clarinetti bassi e nastro. la composizione sarebbe in tre movimenti, il primo basato sulla produzione di feedback attraverso l'amplificazione degli strumenti, il secondo con due clarinetti bassi e nastro, il terzo solo con due clarinetti bassi. Ogni movimento è eseguibile separatamente. Ho lavorato con musicisti austriaci (duo Stump Linshalm e due loro allieve Caroline Wuest e Anna Koch, giovani e molto brave, come puoi sentire), potrebbe essere interessante per il festival di Bludenz (non il prossimo ovviamente). a presto Emiliano

item.title: Nadim - 2017-04-20 15:00:53
item.content:encoded:
Dear Iannotta, I'm 33 years old composer and conductor from Syria. I studied and live in Krakow/Poland. Recently I've got to know your music and i must say that it's very interesting and i'm very fascinated by it. I would like kindly to ask you where and how can i get to borrow or buy your scores? As i'm very interested in having a look at some of your pieces for my own study purpose only. Would be grateful for your kind reply. Best regards. <!--more--> AUTHOR: Nadim AUTHOR EMAIL: nadem.husni@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 213.61.32.210 Array ( [Name] => Nadim [E-mail Address] => nadem.husni@gmail.com [Message] => Dear Iannotta, I'm 33 years old composer and conductor from Syria. I studied and live in Krakow/Poland. Recently I've got to know your music and i must say that it's very interesting and i'm very fascinated by it. I would like kindly to ask you where and how can i get to borrow or buy your scores? As i'm very interested in having a look at some of your pieces for my own study purpose only. Would be grateful for your kind reply. Best regards.
)

item.content:encoded: Dear Clara Iannotta, we want to send to you an Invitation to participate in the 7th Johann-Joseph-Fux Competition for Opera Composition at the University of Music and Performing Arts Graz. Please send us your e-mail address so that we can send you the registration documents. Many thanks and kind regards Sabine Laller (Office for Competitions) <!--more--> AUTHOR: Kunstuniversität Graz - Büro für Wettbewerbe AUTHOR EMAIL: sabine.laller@kug.ac.at AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 193.170.130.237 Array ( [Name] => Kunstuniversität Graz - Büro für Wettbewerbe [E-mail Address] => sabine.laller@kug.ac.at [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta, we want to send to you an Invitation to participate in the 7th Johann-Joseph-Fux Competition for Opera Composition at the University of Music and Performing Arts Graz. item.title: Perttu Haapanen - 2017-04-29 11:01:07
item.content:encoded: Dear Clara, I'm writing to you on behalf of Uusinta Ensemble from Finland (www.uusintaensemble.fi). I have started there as artistic director recently and we are planning forthcoming concerts. I would be interested in your piece "The people here go mad. They blame the wind", but I couldn't find a recording of the piece or the score. May I ask if you had either one or the both of them as perusal materials? I would also like to ask about music boxes; is that the machine which is needed for performances? Many thanks already in advance! best regards, Perttu Haapanen <!--more--> AUTHOR: Perttu Haapanen AUTHOR EMAIL: perttu@uusintaensemble.fi AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 37.219.52.130 Array ( [Name] => Perttu Haapanen [E-mail Address] => perttu@uusintaensemble.fi [Message] => Dear Clara, I'm writing to you on behalf of Uusinta Ensemble from Finland (www.uusintaensemble.fi). I have started there as artistic director recently and we are planning forthcoming concerts. I would be interested in your piece "The people here go mad. They blame the wind", but I couldn't find a recording of the piece or the score. May I ask if you had either one or the both of them as perusal materials? I would also like to ask about music boxes; is that the machine which is needed for performances? Many thanks already in advance! best regards, Perttu Haapanen )

item.title: Jean-Michaël Lavoie - 2017-04-30 04:00:37
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta, I am getting in touch with you because I am very interested by your music. I first heard the world premiere of your "Intent on Resurrection - Spring or Such Thing" at the Cité de la musique in Paris.
Firstly, I would like to explore with you the possibility to invite you at the Faculté de musique de l'Université de Montréal to have a focus on your music and, secondly, to explore the possibility to commission a new piece for Ensemble Ars Nova in France for Fall 2018, where I will be the next Director starting next year.
How busy is your schedule at that time?
Thank you very much, and looking forward to hearing from you soon. Best regards,
Jean-Michaël Lavoie Director Designate, Ensemble Ars Nova (2018) Professeur adjoint & Directeur de l'Atelier de musique contemporaine at Université de Montréal <!--more--> AUTHOR: Jean-Michaël Lavoie AUTHOR EMAIL: jean-michael.lavoie@umontreal.ca AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 70.16.100.187 Array ( [Name] => Jean-Michaël Lavoie [E-mail Address] => jean-michael.lavoie@umontreal.ca [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta, I am getting in touch with you because I am very interested by your music. I first heard the world premiere of your "Intent on Resurrection - Spring or Such Thing" at the Cité de la musique in Paris.
Firstly, I would like to explore with you the possibility to invite you at the Faculté de musique de l'Université de Montréal to have a focus on your music and, secondly, to explore the possibility to commission a new piece for Ensemble Ars Nova in France for Fall 2018, where I will be the next Director starting next year.
How busy is your schedule at that time?
Thank you very much, and looking forward to hearing from you soon. Best regards,
Jean-Michaël Lavoie Director Designate, Ensemble Ars Nova (2018) Professeur adjoint & Directeur de l'Atelier de musique contemporaine at Université de Montréal )

I first heard the world premiere of your "Intent on Resurrection - Spring or Such Thing" at the Cité de la musique in Paris.
Firstly, I would like to explore with you the possibility to invite you at the Faculté de musique de l'Université de Montréal to have a focus on your music and, secondly, to explore the possibility to commission a new piece for Ensemble Ars Nova in France for Fall 2018, where I will be the next Director starting next year.
How busy is your schedule at that time?
Thank you very much, and looking forward to hearing from you soon. Best regards,
Jean-Michaël Lavoie Director Designate, Ensemble Ars Nova (2018) Professeur adjoint & Directeur de l'Atelier de musique contemporaine at Université de Montréal
Time: Sunday April 30, 2017 at 4:00 am IP Address: 70.16.100.187 Contact Form URL: http://claraiannotta.com/contact/

item.title: Mariella Bachmann - 2017-05-04 22:27:57
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta,
My name is Mariella Bachmann, I'm a clarinet player based in Basel/Switzerland and working with a main focus on contemporary music. Some time ago, (probably in 2015?) I heard a wonderful performance in Zürich of your Trio "The people here go mad. They blame the wind." with Trio Catch and I was very inspired by your work and your music. As I am planning a Trio concert for 2018 with two other musicians from Basel, we got really interested in that piece. So we would kindly like to ask you for more informations about the performance possibilities, the piece itself and if there is like an official/edited version of the score.
Many thanks and best regards, Mariella
Allschwilerstrasse 25 4055 Basel mariella.ba@me.com +41 79 611 81 84 www.mariellabachmann.ch <!--more--> AUTHOR: Mariella Bachmann AUTHOR EMAIL: mariella.ba@me.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 178.197.232.157 Array ( [Name] => Mariella Bachmann [E-mail Address] => mariella.ba@me.com [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta,
My name is Mariella Bachmann, I'm a clarinet player based in Basel/Switzerland and working with a main focus on contemporary music. Some time ago, (probably in 2015?) I heard a wonderful performance in Zürich of your Trio "The people here go mad. They blame the wind." with Trio Catch and I was very inspired by your work and your music. As I am planning a Trio concert for 2018 with two other musicians from Basel, we got really interested in that piece. So we would kindly like to ask you for more informations about the performance possibilities, the piece itself and if there is like an official/edited version of the score.
Many thanks and best regards, Mariella
Allschwilerstrasse 25 4055 Basel mariella.ba@me.com +41 79 611 81 84 www.mariellabachmann.ch )

item.title: Ulrich Steffen Eck - 2017-05-07 09:44:52
item.content:encoded:
Hello Clara,
We are just about to publish your composer portrait on www.zinfonia.com on behalf of Peters Edition.
As I could not find your exact day of birth - could you please be so kind as to help me with information?
(We may leave your entry as it is now: with only place and year of birth. But for some search options and our anniversary calendarium on start page it would be great to have it all as correct as possible.
Thanks and all the best
--
Ulrich Steffen Eck European Customer Support Manager Zinfonia Administrator
+46 (0) 72 55 32 150 +49 (0) 1578 35 88 950 http://btmi.com.au http://zinfonia.com <!--more--> AUTHOR: Ulrich Steffen Eck AUTHOR EMAIL: eck@btmi.com.au AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 2.69.176.25 Array ( [Name] => Ulrich Steffen Eck [E-mail Address] => eck@btmi.com.au [Message] => Hello Clara,

(We may leave your entry as it is now: with only place and year of birth. But for some search options and our anniversary calendarium on start page it would be great to have it all as correct as possible.
Thanks and all the best
--
Ulrich Steffen Eck European Customer Support Manager Zinfonia Administrator
+46 (0) 72 55 32 150 +49 (0) 1578 35 88 950 http://btmi.com.au http://zinfonia.com
)
