item.title: Matthew Teodori - 2017-05-09 19:36:37
item.content:encoded:
Hi Clara,
My name is Matt Teodori, and I’m writing on behalf of line upon line. We’re a percussion trio based in Austin, TX.
We’ve very much admired your work for some time, and are curious if discussing the possibility of a percussion trio may be of interest to you?
All best, Matt
Matthew Teodori, Executive & Artistic Director lineuponlinepercussion.org <!--more--> AUTHOR: Matthew Teodori AUTHOR EMAIL: lineuponlinepercussion@gmail.com AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 24.155.245.8 Array ( [Name] => Matthew Teodori [E-mail Address] => lineuponlinepercussion@gmail.com [Message] => Hi Clara,
My name is Matt Teodori, and I’m writing on behalf of line upon line. We’re a percussion trio based in Austin, TX.
We’ve very much admired your work for some time, and are curious if discussing the possibility of a percussion trio may be of interest to you?
All best, Matt
Matthew Teodori, Executive & Artistic Director lineuponlinepercussion.org
)

item.title: Melissa Portaels - 2017-05-16 15:14:13
item.content:encoded:
Dear Mrs Ianotta,
I work as a librarian for MATRIX, Belgiums primary New Music Centre, based in Leuven. Our ever expanding library holds over 40.000 scores and recordings of music composed after 1950. We’re always on the look-out for new, interesting works to enrich our library which is how we took a great interest in your music. I think it would be a wonderful addition to our collection of contemporary composers. However, your scores seem to be unavailable (yet) through a publisher. If you’re interested in contributing to our collection by sending us a representative selection of your work, we would happily include them in our library, where they can be consulted by students, musicians, researchers, and so on. For more info about MATRIX you can take a look at our website (http://www.matrix-new-music.be/en), and feel free to contact me with any further questions!
Many thanks for considering my request.
All the best, Melissa <!--more--> AUTHOR: Melissa Portaels AUTHOR EMAIL: melissa@matrix-new-music.be AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 134.58.253.56 Array ( [Name] => Melissa Portaels [E-mail Address] => melissa@matrix-new-music.be [Message] => Dear Mrs Ianotta,
I work as a librarian for MATRIX, Belgiums primary New Music Centre, based in Leuven. Our ever expanding library holds over 40.000 scores and recordings of music composed after 1950. We’re always on the look-out for new, interesting works to enrich our library which is how we took a great interest in your music. I think it would be a wonderful addition to our collection of contemporary composers. However, your scores seem to be unavailable (yet) through a publisher. If you’re interested in contributing to our collection by sending us a representative selection of your work, we would happily include them in our library, where they can be consulted by students, musicians, researchers, and so on. For more info about MATRIX you can take a look at our website (http://www.matrix-new-music.be/en), and feel free to contact me with any further questions!
Many thanks for considering my request.
All the best, Melissa )

item.title: Sébastien Boin - 2017-06-13 17:57:42
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta,
I am the conductor and artistic manager of the Ensemble C Barré, a french contemporary ensemble based in Marseille, and associated with the GMEM, one of the french national center for musical creation.
We are planning a concert with both C Barré and ICE (New York) ensembles in the Festival "Les Musiques" of Marseille in May 2018, and are wondering if you would be free in order to compose a new work for us at this occasion.
I guess it would be very soon for you but I try!
We thought to a work for 12-17 musicians and electronics, for which you could come into a residence in Marseille (at the GMEM, for electronics).
The instrumentation of the ensemble C Barré is very special : - Clarinette (all kind of), - Saxophone (from sopranino to baritone) (also doudouk), - Trumpet (also piccolo, Bugle and baroque trumpet) - Percussions - Accordion - Mandolin (also mandole, mandoloncelle, mandolone, banjo, bouzouki, electric mandolin) - Guitar (also electric guitar, 12 strings guitar, chromatic & 1/3 tone zithers, mandolin, electric mandolin, oud, ukulele) - Harp - Cymbalum - Piano (also Fender Rhodes and electronic keyboard (Nord Stage 88)) - Cello - Double bass
I already know that one of the 5 ICE musicians will be a percussionist, we could maybe speak together about the 4 other musicians available in their ensemble at this occasion.
During this concert, which should take place between may 14th and 18th, we plan to premiere works for ensemble and electronics by Nathan Davis, Christopher Trapani and Francesca Verunelli.
Please let me know your thoughts about this idea,
Thanks so much, and best regards,
Sébastien Boin <!--more--> AUTHOR: Sébastien Boin AUTHOR EMAIL: sebastienboin@cbarre.fr AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 185.61.188.34 Array ( [Name] => Sébastien Boin [E-mail Address] => sebastienboin@cbarre.fr [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta,
I am the conductor and artistic manager of the Ensemble C Barré, a french contemporary ensemble based in Marseille, and associated with the GMEM, one of the french national center for musical creation.
We are planning a concert with both C Barré and ICE (New York) ensembles in the Festival "Les Musiques" of Marseille in May 2018, and are wondering if you would be free in order to compose a new work for us at this occasion.
I guess it would be very soon for you but I try!
We thought to a work for 12-17 musicians and electronics, for which you could come into a residence in Marseille (at the GMEM, for electronics).
The instrumentation of the ensemble C Barré is very special : - Clarinette (all kind of), - Saxophone (from sopranino to baritone) (also doudouk), - Trumpet (also piccolo, Bugle and baroque trumpet) - Percussions - Accordion - Mandolin (also mandole, mandoloncelle, mandolone, banjo, bouzouki, electric mandolin) - Guitar (also electric guitar, 12 strings guitar, chromatic & 1/3 tone zithers, mandolin, electric mandolin, oud, ukulele) - Harp - Cymbalum - Piano (also Fender Rhodes and electronic keyboard (Nord Stage 88)) - Cello - Double bass
I already know that one of the 5 ICE musicians will be a percussionist, we could maybe speak together about the 4 other musicians available in their ensemble at this occasion.
During this concert, which should take place between may 14th and 18th, we plan to premiere works for ensemble and electronics by Nathan Davis, Christopher Trapani and Francesca Verunelli.
Please let me know your thoughts about this idea,
Thanks so much, and best regards,
Sébastien Boin
)

item.title: E-MEX-Ensemble/Evelin Degen - 2017-06-19 23:51:48
item.content:encoded:
Dear Clara Iannotta, My name is Evelin Degen and I’m the artistic director of the E-MEX ensemble based in Essen Germany (www.e-mex.de). I’m writing you about a project that we are planning in collaboration with the renowned dancer and choreographer Joachim Schlömer (http://www.joachimschloemer.com) schedule for summer/fall 2018. The premier will be in Essen. We are currently looking for a composer. If you are interested, I could send you a copy of the current preliminary proposal for Blackbird so that you can get an idea of project. We would be thrilled if you would be interested in working with us in this project and would welcome the chance to discuss with you further about the specifics of the commission and the collaboration. Best regards, Evelin Degen <!--more--> AUTHOR: E-MEX-Ensemble/Evelin Degen AUTHOR EMAIL: degen@e-mex-ensemble.de AUTHOR URL: SUBJECT: Contact e-mail from claraiannota.com IP: 84.61.140.133 Array ( [Name] => E-MEX-Ensemble/Evelin Degen [E-mail Address] => degen@e-mex-ensemble.de [Message] => Dear Clara Iannotta, My name is Evelin Degen and I’m the artistic director of the E-MEX ensemble based in Essen Germany (www.e-mex.de). I’m writing you about a project that we are planning in collaboration with the renowned dancer and choreographer Joachim Schlömer (http://www.joachimschloemer.com) schedule for summer/fall 2018. The premier will be in Essen. We are currently looking for a composer. If you are interested, I could send you a copy of the current preliminary proposal for Blackbird so that you can get an idea of project. We would be thrilled if you would be interested in working with us in this project and would welcome the chance to discuss with you further about the specifics of the commission and the collaboration. Best regards, Evelin Degen
)
